hackathon-description-text: HealthHack is back again, bringing together health and technology disciplines to once again inspire and create. We'll be focussing on serious games in the health sector, using the latest biomedical technologies.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Imperial College Department of Surgery & Cancer

hackathon-eligibility:
Teams can have up to 5 members.
Only one submission per team, to a chosen category.
hackathon-requirements: Please submit your presentation slides, along with source code preferably via GitHub.
hackathon-rules: All attendees, sponsors, partners, volunteers and staff at our hackathon are required to agree with the code of conduct, given in the link below:
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=2 Prince Consort Rd, Kensington, London SW7 2BB, UK

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Hacks are judged upon various criteria based around how well they  tackle the presented problem. Unimplemented ideas and understanding of the problem may also be taken into account.

hackathon-location-address: 2 Prince Consort Rd, Kensington, London SW7 2BB, UK
hackathon-description-header: Medics and techs - skills to share, making an impact on healthcare.
hackathon-location-description: Imperial College London, Sir Alexander Fleming Building
